sentence.Network_en: She has nothing but a long long haulm.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English healm, halm, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch halm and German Halm, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin culmus 'stalk' and Greek kalamos 'reed'

means.word_mean: 1. stems of beans and peas and potatoes and grasses collectively as used for thatching and bedding
